alert.note: Alert for Bell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 18 at 4:50AM EST until February 18 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Kentucky... Cumberland River at Pineville affecting Bell County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Cumberland River at Pineville. * WHEN...From early this morning to this evening. * IMPACTS...At 1002.0 feet, Low lying roads flood, including portions of Straight Creek, Dorton Branch, and Fourmile Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:30 AM EST Saturday the stage was 1001.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 979.0 feet Wednesday evening. - Action stage is 995.0 feet. - Flood stage is 1002.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. The next statement will be issued 1 PM EST.
